column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Paint a Candy House in Watercolor
#Text=Toward the end of the year , candy and sweets lurk around every corner .
#Text=Those visions of sugarplums can be used make art .
#Text=Doing a painting of a house made of candy is a fun way to indulge without eating too much sugar or spending a lot of cash .
#Text=The resulting painting will last for years and starts with a simple rectangle .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Assemble your candy references .
#Text=Shop in the bulk aisle at your grocery store and buy tiny amounts of various candies to use as models .
#Text=Or , cut pictures of holiday candies , cakes , cookies out of newspapers , magazines and advertisements .
#Text=Assemble your art supplies .
#Text=An 11 ” x 14 ” piece of 140 lb. watercolor paper from a pad , a set of watercolors in a full range of colors , plus black , and an assortment of watercolor brushes .
#Text=You 'll also need a pencil , eraser , ruler and a fine line Sharpie in black .
#Text=Lay out the beginnings of your house .
#Text=Begin by drawing , in pencil , a rectangle .
#Text=Use a template if you wish , a box , disk sleeve or other rectangular item .
#Text=Place this somewhere in the center of your page .
#Text=Construct the roof .
#Text=Find the center of your rectangle at and draw 3 ” vertical line upward .
#Text=The top end of the line will be the peak of the roof .
#Text=Construct the roof by drawing a line down each side to form a large triangle .
#Text=Use a curvy item as a template for roof edge , if you wish .
#Text=Return to the body of the house and draw the door .
#Text=Make it as tall and as wide as you wish .
#Text=On either side , draw two square windows .
#Text=Decorate the house with candy shapes .
#Text=Look at your references and analyze the various types and styles of candies .
#Text=These will be your building materials , so look over their various sizes and shapes .
#Text=Try to picture which candy would look best at what point on your house .
#Text=Begin to put candy on the house .
#Text=Sketch candy of one shape in pencil , repeatedly , to fill one area of your house .
#Text=For example , for the front , you might have round candies to mimic siding shingles .
#Text=Imagine how you want the roof to be .
#Text=You might use long candies to edge the roof or make it piled with snow -- -marshmallow fluff to mimic snow .
#Text=By working in pencil , you can make changes easily if one idea does n't work out .
#Text=Erase and try something else .
#Text=Create a suitably sweet environment for your house .
#Text=Use varied sizes , shapes and colors of candies to make trees , pathways , rocks , signposts , and trimming around the corners of the house and its windows .
#Text=Candy canes make good lampposts .
#Text=Green lollipops look a bit like ornamental trees .
#Text=Long , narrow candies standing in a row resemble a fence .
#Text=Pile on the candy until much of the house is covered .
#Text=The landscape ought to be a magical place where candy reigns supreme .
#Text=Remember to populate the scene .
#Text=Gingerbread men , women and children look exactly right as residents of a candy house .
#Text=Go over the pencil drawing with fine line permanent black marker .
#Text=Activate your paints with drops of water .
#Text=Begin to paint the design .
#Text=The hard work is done if you have taken time to make your drawing detailed and complete .
#Text=Look to see where a color can be used in another part of the design .
#Text=While you have one color on your brush , use it wherever else it is needed .
#Text=Wash in a solid color for a sky .
#Text=This will be a nice backdrop for the colorful candy .
#Text=With so much going on in the picture a simple sky will be nice .
#Text=Work until the piece looks finished .
#Text=Allow it to dry and give it another look .
#Text=If any part needs punching up do it .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Allow the paint to dry before attempting to put another color close to it unless you want the two colors to mingle .
#Text=As you paint , work the colors from one spot into other areas of the design .
#Text=Instead of working in sections and completing one area at a time aim to keep the whole painting involved .
#Text=This all over approach to color will give a sense of unity to your work , having various shades sprinkled throughout the page .
